1301.desc: The footprints of Lugina and the others who had gone ahead have vanished. Strong gusts of wind hit the sand dunes, continuously changing their shape.
1301.name: Smoldering Sun

1302.desc: The blazing sun is wearing you down, dehydrating you. You've crossed many scorching territories so far, but somehow never seem to grow used to them.
1302.name: Becoming Cinders

1303.desc: As the sparkling sand reflects the sunlight, your feet grow hotter and hotter. At this rate they'll end up well-done while they roast...
1303.name: Hot Sand's Furnace

1304.desc: Your thirst and the sun aren't your only enemies. Afla Dilith has dispatched assassins who are closing in on you. The end of the desert isn't far now.
1304.name: Infinite Valor

1310.desc: Indeed there are other gods besides the Four Fallen that reject the existence of humans. However, let's focus on the task at hand for now.
1310.name: Abyss of Sea Snakes

1311.desc: The sun shines through an ice wall and though no light is lit within the temple, it's bright inside. The light suddenly refracts, creating a rainbow.
1311.name: Rainbow Bubble

1312.desc: The solitude of the ice temple makes for a very relaxing atmosphere. However, with enemies incoming, you have no time to rest.
1312.name: Across the Raging Sea

1313.desc: Could this temple also be the work of the gods? Or is it the masterpiece of a person with otherworldly powers? It piques your curiosity.
1313.name: Shelf of Ice Crystals

1314.desc: Everything is gradually turning brighter. The exit may be close, but things will probably not be as simple as you think.
1314.name: Unforgettable Heart

1320.desc: An ancient forest that few have visited before. There seem to be no natural paths. You'll have to use your sense of direction to get out of this one.
1320.name: Enchanted Fairy Grove

1321.desc: A strange feeling overcomes you. You've sensed this atmosphere in many of the forests you have passed through so far. No doubt spirits are near.
1321.name: Treetops of Illusion

1322.desc: Along with a shrilling cry, a flock of birds flies off frightened. A loud roar follows after. It's the sound of an otherworldly machine at work!
1322.name: The Hive's Den

1323.desc: You get the feeling that something is inviting you deep into the sea of trees. You can't help thinking you're being led to a den full of enemies.
1323.name: Noble Monarch

1324.desc: The space between the trees has widened. The end of the forest may be near. This can only mean that enemies more powerful than before await you.
1324.name: Relentless Blade

1330.desc: The fate of the future... What Paris told you is starting to make sense. However, you must first focus on defeating the last Fallen God.
1330.name: Electric Eyes

1331.desc: The large drops of rain won't stop, striking you as they fall. Your body gets colder, and as you sneeze, the sound of thunder resonates around you.
1331.name: Thunder Beast's Clash

1332.desc: You can tell that in Aldahlia the buildings soaked in rainwater have been eroding away. You start to wonder how long this rain will keep falling.
1332.name: Like a Lighting Flash

1333.desc: A bright bolt of lightning tears the sky apart. After a second of waiting, a deafening sound hits your ears. Lighting struck dangerously close.
1333.name: Creator of Ruin

1334.desc: The continuous roaring of the thunder has made your ears feel funny. You wouldn't survive an ambush in this state, so you best be cautious.
1334.name: No Surrender

1340.desc: It's still a long way to Afla Dilith, but everyone keeps talking about what will come after that. Let's not worry about those things for now.
1340.name: Herd of Pegasus

1341.desc: The herd of Pegasus was just frightened, but something more alarming soars the skies. War goddesses spread their wings to prepare for battle.
1341.name: Imperial Guard Honor

1342.desc: This road offers a clear view of the surroundings, so there's no fear of an ambush. However, there's nothing you can use to deflect aerial attacks.
1342.name: The Path You Trust

1343.desc: How long have you advanced? Now you can really see the castle Afla Dilith has assimilated with. Is that what you will face in the future?
1343.name: Radiant Strike

1344.desc: A road for pilgrims. Long ago, pilgrims passed through here to pray to the gods. Ironically, you're taking this road in order to defeat a god.
1344.name: Where Loyalty Lies

1345.desc: The end of the road is near. A strong power can be felt coming from it. The enemy lurking there will most likely be your last obstacle here.
1345.name: Unforgiving Light

1350.desc: You are overwhelmed by the gigantic stature of the castle-like Afla Dilith. However, everyone is counting on you, so there's no time to waste.
1350.name: The Lifeless Snake

1351.desc: There are still many enemies left on the way to the castle. Surely Karl and the others will have to face even more of them as you move on ahead.
1351.name: Crawling Toward Death

1352.desc: The sound of your allies fighting behind you grows louder. Head towards the castle while everyone else draws the enemies' attention.
1352.name: The Putrid Tome

1353.desc: The enemies in your path continue getting stronger. It can only mean that your last target is drawing near. The castle's gates should be just ahead.
1353.name: Heaps of Corpses

1354.desc: The castle is within a stone's throw, and the god's powerful presence grows stronger. However, it's no time to buckle under pressure. Step inside.
1354.name: The Final Hour

1355.desc: You can see the last hoard of enemies in front of the gate. If you can get past them, you will finally be inside Afla Dilith!
1355.name: Fighting Death

1360.desc: Tilith, Karl, everyone... You're worried about the friends you left behind fighting. However, there's no turning back now. You must press forward.
1360.name: Ends & Beginnings

1361.desc: Looking inside the castle, nothing really seems out of place. Although without Tilith's protective barrier, you might have fallen prey to Afla Dilith.
1361.name: Heaven & Earth Divide

1362.desc: You can hear Tilith fighting from the entrance. Inspired by her courage, your feet rush forward at full speed!
1362.name: Turning the Tide

1363.desc: As you proceed further in, the sounds of battle coming from the entrance disappear. You can still feel Tilith's barrier protecting you, though.
1363.name: Rejecting Sublation

1364.desc: You've made your way through a big portion of the fortress. Past this corridor lies its center. The real body of the Fallen God is probably there.
1364.name: Universal Equality

1365.desc: You exit into a room enveloped in tree roots. The next step should lead you to the heart of the castle, but a dark hero blocks your path.
1365.name: Back to the Roots

1366.desc: The time for the real final fight with the last Fallen God, the Beast God Afla Dilith, has come... Defeat him and return to your friends!
1366.name: The God of Truth

1370.desc: After visiting the temple a second time, you think you hear the voice of a young girl singing. Her song made the rough waves vanish like the sea foam.
1370.name: Song from the Seabed

1400.desc: A hair raising howling can be heard. It looks like many monsters seem to inhabit this town, so there seems to be no easy escape from here.
1400.name: Blazing Transgression

1401.desc: A beautiful singing voice lingers in the air. Could this be the work of a demon as well? And why have so many monsters gathered in this ghost town?
1401.name: Cursed Singing Voice

1402.desc: How strange. No matter how much you advance, you keep finding yourself back where you started. It's like being in the fairies' grove all over again.
1402.name: Idle Gossip

1403.desc: There are too many enemies. What could've led them here? As you think that to yourself, a piercing and thunderous sound resonates around you.
1403.name: Within the Commotion

1404.desc: The neigh of a Pegasus reaches your ears, a pure sound ill-fitted for this ghost town. A battle with the maidens awaits ahead.
1404.name: Meeting the Maidens

1405.desc: You can feel many more enemies obstructing your way now. If you're lucky enough, defeating the last hoard of them might be your ticket out of here.
1405.name: Night Draws Near

1410.desc: You can see a vast desert in front of you. There seems to be no end to it, but you must take this cruel path in order to move forward.
1410.name: Vast Sea of Sand

1411.desc: You confirm the sun's location to avoid losing your way. Short on patience and with your body almost boiling, beads of sweat fall from your forehead.
1411.name: Great Desert Path

1412.desc: A cloud of sand starts covering your clothes. You swallow the fine pieces of sand the wind picks up as you breathe. Deserts are still not your forte.
1412.name: The Sword & Axe Dance

1413.desc: As the sunshine gets hotter, heat haze begins to rise from beneath. Beyond the shaky mirage in front of you, you spy the creeping shadow of the enemy.
1413.name: Rising Heat Shimmer

1414.desc: A cloudless, blue firmament above, and scorching, yellow sand beneath. As you look behind you, everything grows darker. A sandstorm is on its way.
1414.name: Before the Sandstorm

1420.desc: After leaving the great the desert behind, you come across a river so big that the shore seems invisible. It will take a lot of effort to cross it.
1420.name: Crossing the River

1421.desc: At times, the river fish jump high up. Surprised by the sound, you finally see the enemy closing in. You realize now the fish were trying to warn you.
1421.name: The Deep Riverbed

1422.desc: Halfway up the river you hear a creaking noise and see that the surface of the river has begun to freeze. It seems the enemy is here.
1422.name: Glistening Riverside

1423.desc: As you admire the grandeur of this river, you reminisce of battle. Even though you have defeated the Four Fallen Gods, other battles still lie ahead.
1423.name: In Order to Flow

1424.desc: A strong wind blows. The water's surface ripples, and then crashes in a big splash. It may be a sign of the road up ahead, which makes you nervous.
1424.name: Surging Bay Breeze

1430.desc: As you walk through the thick forest, you get lost. The path to a free future... You'll have to make your own way to get there.
1430.name: Endless Foliage

1431.desc: You arrive at a place in the forest where a small spring bubbles. You consider taking a rest, but enemies start appearing one by one. Break's over.
1431.name: The Forest's Fountain

1432.desc: A strong wind blows in the forest. As the leaves brush upon each other they sound like the waves of the ocean. It's a sea of trees indeed.
1432.name: Godspeed Gale

1433.desc: Breeze blows strongly through the trees, picking up old leaves, and fluttering new ones. This is the force that transforms the forest anew.
1433.name: Budding Earth

1434.desc: The sea of trees sways as the wind hits it. One could say that even these living beings feel anxious about the future fate of the world.
1434.name: Boisterous Trees

1440.desc: The rough, shiny rock around shows traces of lightning. It seems it has been absorbing it during the endless storms. Pressing forward won't be easy.
1440.name: A Painful Climb

1441.desc: As you climb an electrified cliff, you pass peaks as sharp as needles. You can't help but feel like this road is a premonition of the future to come.
1441.name: Watcher at the Summit

1442.desc: The thunder and lightning that falls here is absorbed by the mountain. It has accumulated so much after the years that it might burst any minute now.
1442.name: Dark Clouds Await

1443.desc: You've reached the Mt. Granakia's highest peak, where you can see the whole of Atharva. You see a giant castle in the distance. Is that Eriole's base?
1443.name: Higher than the Sky

1444.desc: You can see Paris at the bottom of the cliff. It seems she followed you here. You were told to talk to her, but what exactly do you have in mind?
1444.name: Wind Blows to Heaven

1450.desc: After climbing over the mountain, you reach a beautiful garden. However, no people seem to come here, so how has it been kept so well maintained?
1450.name: The Garden of Life

1451.desc: Beautiful flower beds are arranged next to each other in the garden. These amazing flowers couldn't have bloomed without lots of care, and yet...
1451.name: Flowers Bloom Proudly

1452.desc: You can see a fountain amidst the flower beds. The water sparkles as it flows from a beautifully carved pedestal. What a great spectacle to behold.
1452.name: Pursuing Wisdom

1453.desc: Small birds flutter about, chirping a song. One flees suddenly, and when you follow it with your eyes, you see a great shadow dropping from the sky...
1453.name: Revering the Heavens

1454.desc: The floral aroma, the chirping of the birds, and the beauty of the trimmed hedges... Looking at it now, this is a beautiful, if not perfect, garden.
1454.name: Instrumental Trio

1455.desc: Could this garden have been made by human hands? How could it have remained so beautiful without any people left to care for it?
1455.name: Demanding Justice

1456.desc: Small flowers sway in the wind, butterflies flutter about, and the birds fly high in the sky. A wind of new beginnings is leaving the old age behind.
1456.name: Wind of Beginnings

1460.desc: Having passed the gorgeous garden, you reach a gloomy cemetery. Among the expressionless tombstones standing, a voice calls from within the silence.
1460.name: Where Souls Sleep

1461.desc: Tesla said Paris was useless to them now. If Eriole truly feels that way, then just what could he be after...?
1461.name: Graveyard Banquet

1462.desc: This part of the cemetery seems to be dedicated to soldiers fallen in battle. You can see that their tombstones have a sword symbol carved onto them.
1462.name: A Soldier's Tombstone

1463.desc: If a civil war breaks in Elgaia, many lives will be lost. This must be prevented at all costs.
1463.name: Funeral Candles

1464.desc: Reading the few words you can make out from the headstones, you gather that this was once one of the most important places in Atharva.
1464.name: Carved Slab

1465.desc: You feel something cold run down your spine. Feeling an evil presence, you look around you. Darkness is closing in, the enemy's coming!
1465.name: Dangerous Territory

1466.desc: Not even the wind seems to reach this place, and your movements start to feel sluggish. The smell of moss and mold lingers in the air.
1466.name: Winding Down

1470.desc: The spark of battle has been ignited. Defeat the enemies standing in your way, and head towards the depths of Eriole's castle!
1470.name: To the Shiny Palace

1471.desc: A cold steel blade strikes at you, and fiery claws rush towards you. No matter who the enemy may be, you must not falter!
1471.name: Gate to a New Era

1472.desc: A fist cracks the floor open, and a lance tries to pierce you as you counterattack. Strong enemies have gathered here, but you must press on!
1472.name: Garden of Truth

1473.desc: Lightning flashes in the hall, and a sword that seems to block darkness shimmers brightly. If you want to stop the revolution, focus on the enemy now!
1473.name: The Sage & the Hero

1474.desc: Light pierces the walls, and countless arrows begin to rain down. The enemy is strong, but you still have morale. Hurry and make your way through!
1474.name: Establishing Order

1475.desc: Dual blades dance in the air, and one strike from a hefty lance breaks the floor open. Just a bit more till you face Eriole deep in the castle.
1475.name: Thriving Cornerstone

1476.desc: The shadow overhead is just as strong as the light. The world is being distorted, probably tearing at the seams. You're just steps away from Eriole!
1476.name: Unification Pillar

1477.desc: Eriole's ideas are warped. The idea that a bloody revolution can bring about a peaceful future cannot possibly be true. He must be stopped.
1477.name: Changing the World

1480.desc: You discover a cave dispersing an ominous miasma. There are traces of a strong seal at the entrance, but you seem to be able to come and go freely.
1480.name: Crucible of Confusion

1500.desc: As you approach the heart of the gloomy forest, you think you hear the cry of the ancient dragon rumored to be sealed within it.
1500.name: The Dragons' Welcome

1501.desc: After fighting away the dragons, you hear the voices of the deceased singing around you. It looks like the creatures of this forest mean to stop you.
1501.name: Chanting Spirits

1502.desc: You get the eerie feeling that someone's watching you. Could it be Ark? No, this stare is from the beings dwelling in the forest.
1502.name: Dance of the Pixies

1503.desc: The dim forest is full of silence. The moment you think your ears have grown accustomed to it, a flock of birds suddenly lets out a shrilling cry.
1503.name: The Birds' Invitation

1504.desc: After the flock of birds has gone, you encounter a group of fighting goddesses. They study you as if trying to gauge your power.
1504.name: Fighting Goddesses

1505.desc: You're almost out of the forest. You want to meet Tilith as soon as possible to talk to her, but the demonic miasma around you refuses to allow it.
1505.name: The Demons' Feast

1510.desc: The combination of Seria's excessively threatening attitude and all your memories of Tilith leave you in silence. You best follow the Goddess anyway.
1510.name: Flickering Heat Haze

1511.desc: The heat haze rising from the sand is as hot as fire itself. It even makes you wonder whether it is actually aflame.
1511.name: Blazing Sand Quake

1512.desc: It is only normal to feel hot in a desert, but you've never felt this degree of heat before. It's a premonition of the enemies who want to stop you.
1512.name: Quelling Supreme Fire

1513.desc: The scorching desert is draining your energy. It doesn't seem like Tilith will appear here, but if you meet her again, you should try talking to her.
1513.name: Roaring Flames

1514.desc: You feel a presence. There's no doubt that Tilith is near. You want to avoid a fight with her, but how will it all turn out...?
1514.name: Plea of the Goddess

1520.desc: A red river flows ahead. It reminds you of a red forest from your previous exploits. Just like during those hard times, Tilith is still by your side.
1520.name: Great Scarlet Stream

1521.desc: What could be awaiting you? You are not completely sure, but watching the crimson waves makes you all the more uneasy.
1521.name: Red Waves

1522.desc: The red splash is freezing. You have now seen this omen of the strong opponents ahead a number of times. Beware of your surroundings and get ready.
1522.name: Frozen Faith

1523.desc: The red current looks just like blood. If humans were to be destroyed once again, the landscape would probably resemble an image like this one.
1523.name: Flowing Crimson Tide

1524.desc: The reflection of the light on the water makes the river sparkle. Its color made you uncomfortable before, but it may make for a beautiful view now.
1524.name: Water's Reflection

1530.desc: You have arrived at a ghost town. It was probably a normal village before it was destroyed. Thick grass grows along the remnants of the streets.
1530.name: Wreckage-Born Plains

1531.desc: You were only worried about were stepped, but now you've noticed a gigantic tower in the distance. It must be the so-called Tower of the Oracle.
1531.name: Bearing Ancient Times

1532.desc: The greenery around you has grown louder. It could all be in your head, but is it possible that the insects are trying to warn you? The enemy's here!
1532.name: Verdant Ruin's Fate

1533.desc: Humans don't fully understand the concept of a god yet. However, looking at Tilith you can't help but to feel there's not much of a difference.
1533.name: Nature's Breath

1534.desc: In the outskirts of the village lies a small shrine. As you go past it, you lay your eyes upon the tower standing ahead. Ark awaits you.
1534.name: Embraced by the Ruins

1540.desc: What could Ark's real motives be? Why is he attempting to test the Summoners' power? Or could he be trying to end it all here?
1540.name: The Gigantic Tower

1541.desc: The enemy is strong. However, you won't just stop fighting. Your ability to stop the Four Fallen Gods was no hoax, but Ark is well aware of that.
1541.name: Seeking the Oracle

1542.desc: Thunder clouds roar within the walls of the tower. Did you set off a trap, or could this be the enemy's power? Either way, you must push through.
1542.name: Pompous Thunder King

1543.desc: You're close to the top of the tower. As you continue forth, you feel a strong presence. Could the beings Ark mentioned be waiting ahead?
1543.name: Traitors of Humanity

1544.desc: What could have those enemies been? Many seemed to have been related to Ark somehow. That must mean that the next enemy is...
1544.name: Twilight of Heroes

1550.desc: Ark's words had a strong impact. What does Lucius plan to do with humanity now? There's no choice but to seek him and ask him directly.
1550.name: Control Gate

1551.desc: When Ark removed his mask, his determination was written all over his face. Will you be able to hear any more important information from him again?
1551.name: The Glory of Victory

1552.desc: Tilith seems completely at a loss about what Ark said regarding Lucius. It seems even she doesn't know everything about her master.
1552.name: Ability to Rule

1553.desc: A tension in the air is putting everything on edge. Is this the wrath of the heroes? Ark's figure is slowly becoming visible.
1553.name: Fire of Knowledge

1554.desc: The curse of Karna Masta... Summoning was believed to be a power granted by Lucius, but things seem more complicated than that.
1554.name: Divine Sword's Anger

1555.desc: The history left behind is only a small portion of the history that has actually taken place. What new knowledge could be awaiting in the future?
1555.name: Radiance of Wisdom

1556.desc: Tilith said she became Lucius's disciple after the great war with the gods. There may be even more things Tilith doesn't know than initially thought.
1556.name: Foundation of Dignity

1560.desc: It seems a fight against Lucius is imminent now. If only you could convince Tilith otherwise...
1560.name: Reverence of Darkness

1561.desc: This place is said to have been where people received divine commands from the gods. It must be a special place for the Oracle Knight Ark.
1561.name: Suspended in the Dark

1562.desc: The rocks' tough exterior seems to want to keep people away, but it may be testing if you have enough strength to finish the dreaded climb.
1562.name: Power and Shadows

1563.desc: How many moons have passed since this mountain lost its original purpose? The darkness that lingers in these mountain paths is quite dense.
1563.name: Faint Tremors

1564.desc: A shadow lurks in the ridge below. This figure clad in jet black armor is perhaps the lone knight the Six Heroes mentioned. It's time for battle.
1564.name: Black Knight Advances

1565.desc: As you make your climb down the steep cliff, demons come after you. Only a little bit more until you reach the Grand Gaia Crater where Lucius awaits.
1565.name: Suppressing Evil

1566.desc: If only Lucius would reconsider his decision of destroying humanity, a battle could be avoided... Is this mentality perhaps too idealistic?
1566.name: Before the Dawn

1570.desc: The battle has finally begun. Lucius seems to have no intentions of listening to humans. Tilith's words are also cause for concern...
1570.name: The Seal has Broken

1571.desc: If Lucius is defeated, only Tilith will be able to control the gate. You must think of a countermeasure to deal with the sealed calamities within.
1571.name: Unsolvable Riddle

1572.desc: You were victorious against all Four Fallen Gods. However, now you fully understand that Lucius's power surpasses that of any previously defeated god.
1572.name: Unreachable Solution

1573.desc: Gods and humans seem to be looking at things quite differently. However, if they mean to destroy humanity, you've no choice but to stop them.
1573.name: Unspoken Things

1574.desc: Lucius doesn't speak much. Did he fool everyone? Or did humans selfishly come up with their own expectations of him?
1574.name: Unknown Wisdom

1575.desc: You wonder if Karl and the others are unharmed. They must have crossed many a powerful enemy on the way here. Quickly, you must reach Lucius!
1575.name: The Path to Freedom

1576.desc: Grand Gaia's Crater... Is this the place where countless calamities lie sealed within? No, now is not the time for distractions.
1576.name: Void of Ignorance

1577.desc: Tilith has led you all the way here. That was Lucius's will. However, now you must fight with your own will in mind!
1577.name: Facing the Sealed God

1580.desc: You have reached the depths of this territory sealed by the gods. Within it lies the results of an experiment that offends their divinity...
1580.name: Squirming Beings

10000.desc: The land of the sealed demons, Ishgria. Many different creatures from those in Elgaia can be found here.
10000.name: Blooming New Land

10001.desc: A large and strangely designed stone structure stands before you. Obviously from a different culture, it draws both curiosity and fear.
10001.name: Dragons & People

10002.desc: In the center of the ruins is a large circular plaza. Though the buildings are abandoned now, this seems to have been a prestigious place.
10002.name: A Different Region

10003.desc: You still feel no presence of menacing demons around you. It was wrong to think that they would be running rampant here, but don't get careless.
10003.name: Dangerous Resources

10004.desc: From the top of the ruins you see a fantastic view of the land. However, when you remember you have to travel it on foot, your motivation fades.
10004.name: Large Mallet Snake

10005.desc: You've felt no demonic presences until now. It looks like finding the demons in charge of this land will prove harder than you initially thought.
10005.name: Light's Winged Blade

10010.desc: A demon appears before you and suddenly attacks. There is no escape. Especially now that you'll serve as a sacrifice for the goddess!
10010.name: Demon Invasion

10011.desc: You never thought that the demon who controls this land would show itself so quickly. Keep your eyes peeled for traps ahead.
10011.name: Fire God's Roar

10012.desc: Bridges have been built over the hot vapors that rise from below. One wrong step, and it's all over. You will need a lot of courage to pass through.
10012.name: Infinite Heat

10013.desc: Thanks to the rising hot vapors your throat has dried up, and your head feels like it's boiling. Even Paris can't hide the fact that she's struggling.
10013.name: Hot Current's Blade

10014.desc: You can finally see the exit, but an incredibly hot wind blows from its direction. Apparently its heat source differs from that of the lava below.
10014.name: Shining Wings of Fire

10020.desc: You come across some beautiful ponds and cascades which resemble sets of stairs. According to Paris, this water is like acid. Don't go for a dip.
10020.name: Opposite of Beauty

10021.desc: This place full of so much dangerous acid makes you wonder if a lot of Ishgria's terrain is similar to this one. It's a bit disconcerting.
10021.name: Frozen Flower's Dew

10022.desc: To your surprise you find creatures resembling fish and small shrimp swimming in the acid. This place is definitely different from Elgaia.
10022.name: Crashing Waves

10023.desc: When you feel something strange on your shoe, you look down to find it has begun to disintegrate. You should watch your step here.
10023.name: Vast Region

10024.desc: You have finally reached the end of the cascades to find yourself in a dark valley of sorts. However, you must defeat a strong enemy to move forward.
10024.name: Wasted Sea Rocks

10030.desc: You step foot into the thick forest in the valley. However, what surrounds you are giant mushrooms, not trees. You feel like a sort of dwarf...
10030.name: At Mushroom Forest

10031.desc: The light cannot reach the depths of this dark forest. Instead, you let yourself be guided through these soft lands by luminous mushrooms.
10031.name: Mushroom Bed

10032.desc: You run into something hard while walking. Surprisingly it seems to be the root of a great tree, but you don't remember seeing any trees around...
10032.name: Nature's Roots

10033.desc: The aroma of many types of mushrooms mixes in the air. So do their spores. You hope these spores aren't bad for your body, but Paris knows better.
10033.name: Night of Spore Rain

10034.desc: It is so quiet that you think you can hear the sound of the spores floating around you. Suddenly though, a ferocious roar breaks the silence.
10034.name: Breaker of Silence

10040.desc: Your eyes had just gotten used to the darkness, when a flash of lightning blinds you. The view you see before you includes giant floating crystals.
10040.name: Forbidden Wisdom

10041.desc: An ominous red light emanates from the chained giant crystals that float midair. To think that you have to walk through such a place...
10041.name: Beacon of Treason

10042.desc: Storms of lightning rage above you, hitting the crystals from time to time. The electricity helps carve stairs and roads on the crystals' surface.
10042.name: Signs of Collapse

10043.desc: You find many rooms within the crystal structures. Do demons live here? Humans wouldn't be able to survive in such a place...
10043.name: Thunder's Direct Hit

10044.desc: You managed to make it through this strange place and resurface to land. However, an opponent seems to be preparing to fight you.
10044.name: Thunder Rock Garden

10050.desc: Lots of preparations are probably being made back home in Elgaia. If possible you want to rescue Tilith before war breaks out, but...
10050.name: Overwhelming Light

10051.desc: You fight your enemies while a pillar shaped light gleams before you. How does this structure work? A terrible demonic aura surrounds this place.
10051.name: Guardian of Splendor

10052.desc: As you contemplate the Light Tower you begin to wonder about the demon civilization. Do they all have different roles to play as humans do?
10052.name: Filled with Light

10053.desc: A demon named Shusui is said to rule these lands. Is it due to his orders that other demons refuse to show themselves?
10053.name: In Pursuit of Light

10054.desc: You're making your way down the tower and will be outside soon. However, the enemies seem to be getting stronger now. Proceed with caution.
10054.name: Noble Light

10060.desc: After exiting the Light Tower, you come across some sparkling trees. Unlike the mushroom forest, these look like real trees, only made of stone.
10060.name: Hymn of Respite

10061.desc: Though you've encountered various creatures in the previous terrains, this one is awfully quiet. Is as if all life here has died out.
10061.name: Forest of Shells

10062.desc: A building in ruins sleeps within the forest. Completely broken down and in shambles, it resembles the bones of a dead gigantic creature.
10062.name: Empty Heart

10063.desc: If you look closely, you can see signs of ancient battles having taken place here. You start to wonder what the exiled disciples' battles were like.
10063.name: Blood's Shine

10064.desc: From an opening in the trees you can see an enormous building in the distance. Is this the Soaring Tree Tower Shusui spoke of? You're almost there.
10064.name: Secret in the Dark

10070.desc: The gigantic tower might as well be a skyscraper piercing the sea of clouds. Could its candle-like branches be the stronghold of a demon?
10070.name: Elementary Steps

10071.desc: As thunder rumbles behind you, you enter the mysterious tower. Before you stands a tough enemy whose plans remain unclear. No choice but to continue.
10071.name: Matchless Pair

10072.desc: Every enemy awaiting you only seems to get stronger by the minute. You're only halfway through the tower, so there's no time to rest yet.
10072.name: Power Barrier

10073.desc: No matter how you think of it, what Shusui says makes little sense. Why is he testing you? You can't read the demon's mind at all.
10073.name: Obstructing Wall

10074.desc: You can feel a great power ahead, but it doesn't belong to a demon. Could it be Shusui's last trial? Better prepare yourself before proceeding.
10074.name: Death God's Purgatory

10075.desc: An entirely different enemy than any of the ones the fallen heroes before you ever faced is expecting you at the top of the tower. Shusui awaits.
10075.name: Tested Power

10080.desc: Shusui suddenly shows himself before you once again. Why is he after you now? Does it have to do with something from this land?
10080.name: Awaiting War God

10100.desc: The burning light of the lava inside the caverns tans your skin. The overwhelming black and red colors blind your vision. Don't let your guard down.
10100.name: Lava Rock Furnace

10101.desc: If you don't watch your step, you may end up stepping in the hot lava. Sticking your foot in there does not look like a good idea.
10101.name: Rakshasa & Disaster

10102.desc: You get an uneasy, yet familiar feeling, and remember the fear of facing a disciple. There's no doubt that a strong enemy awaits ahead.
10102.name: Smoke of Treason

10103.desc: You follow a hot trail. The ground, walls, and even the ceiling is scorching hot. Your feet feel like they're burning through the soles of your shoes.
10103.name: Light Beyond Truth

10104.desc: A ferocious roar echoes through the cavern. At the same time, you feel a cool breeze waft in. It looks like the exit is near.
10104.name: Burning Claws & Tusks

10110.desc: The goddess Mora suddenly appears before you. When she mentions she once served Lord Lucius, you can't help but to remember Tilith.
10110.name: Sea of Steel

10111.desc: You've seen many a spectacular scenery in Ishgria, so now that you're at the Wetlands, you can truly appreciate their bizarre beauty.
10111.name: The Queen & Ice Tower

10112.desc: You feel anxious knowing a presence near you holds terrible power. The humidity of the wetlands clings to your skin, making you really uncomfortable.
10112.name: Tyrannical Foam

10113.desc: Mora guides you through the Wetlands. Since it's Seria and Lugina, you know they are safe, but you can't help to worry a little.
10113.name: Blue Sea Splash

10114.desc: There's a faint aroma of sea breeze in the moist air.  This change can only mean that the end of the Wetlands is near.
10114.name: Swirling Scales

10120.desc: The power of a person similar to Karl has been awakened? What could it mean? You hope Karl is safe as you wonder what this is all about.
10120.name: Dangerous Imps

10121.desc: Paris warns that the thick and overgrown plants here are different from the ones in Grand Gaia. Some of them may be poisonous, so be careful.
10121.name: Tempered Demon Rocks

10122.desc: Another bad feeling. That's the third time since you arrived to Lem. Without a doubt, an enemy with great power approaches. Brace yourself.
10122.name: Flower of Starvation

10123.desc: Pushing your way through an animal trail, you reach a small thicket. Hearing a rustle coming from the bushes, you ready yourself. It was an animal.
10123.name: Rebelling Soldier

10124.desc: The giant trees have cleared out. Now you can probably make it out of the forest quicker. The possibilities of encountering enemies are high though.
10124.name: Forest Bud

10130.desc: Paris can't seem to hide her fascination for the ancient dragon. However, you should hurry forward if you want to make sure everyone's okay.
10130.name: Roaring Thunder Lands

10131.desc: Your body goes slightly numb after approaching an electrified crystal. Best be careful of your surroundings and keep some distance from the crystals.
10131.name: Angel of the Heavens

10132.desc: You feel something ominous. A frightfully strong enemy is bound to show itself at any minute, but there seems to be no way to escape.
10132.name: Crushing Flash

10133.desc: You climb over the great ancient dragon's claws. You don't want to fight an opponent this gigantic, but you may have to in the future...
10133.name: Sparkling Lightning

10134.desc: The small electrified crystals have gotten much bigger, and the dragon's bones are almost invisible now. The Ruins can't be far from here.
10134.name: Past Giant Bones

10140.desc: You're surprised by Paris's course of action. You had vaguely noticed a change, but now it's clear that this Paris is more free spirited than before.
10140.name: Magic Square of Light

10141.desc: You head towards the Ruins in search of Seria and Lugina. Now that Paris is not around, walking behind the silent Mora doesn't feel right.
10141.name: Weapons & Radiance

10142.desc: A bad feeling overcomes you. A sharp, blood thirsty will made of pure evil draws near. There's nowhere to run, so prepare a good counterattack.
10142.name: Star of Ruin

10143.desc: Just how far did Paris go? You can't pick up any presences around you, but whatever you encounter will not be weak. It would be good to regroup.
10143.name: Will of Justice

10144.desc: Things are happening so suddenly, there is no time to react. What could Mora be thinking? There's no time to ponder about that either.
10144.name: Sparkling Rainbow Sky

10150.desc: After being apart for such a long time, you reunite with Seria and Lugina. Now you must begin all preparations necessary to face Mora once again.
10150.name: Escaping the Enemy

10151.desc: The black rocks and red lava remind you of the first caverns you passed through. It's not that hot here, but you're thrown off by the ominous miasma.
10151.name: Demon People

10152.desc: A bad feeling once again. You've felt this countless times by now, this evil intent to kill. And combined with the miasma, chills run down your spine.
10152.name: Crafty Shadow

10153.desc: When you look behind you, it seems as if all the land were illuminated by lightning. Perhaps it's the dragon's suffering. A long bridge stands ahead.
10153.name: Dark Echoing Song

10154.desc: After climbing down a steep hill, you grow closer to the great bridge. The miasma around you makes everything creepier as it points towards the enemy.
10154.name: Fear Filled Darkness

10160.desc: The demon Mora finally reveals her true identity. She says that if you wish to know Karl's whereabouts, you must defeat her first. Can you trust her?
10160.name: Past the Bridge

10161.desc: Crossing the great bridge with Lugina reminds you of your time in Lizeria. With that in mind you wonder how your relationship has made it this far.
10161.name: Dark God's Trap

10162.desc: Thanks to Paris and Lugina's help, you won't face many traps along the way. But the demons Mora has sent come at you one after another.
10162.name: Guide to Calamity

10163.desc: You may have beaten a disciple, but its presence is not completely gone. Countless disciple-like demons come after you, but you're only halfway there.
10163.name: Messenger of Despair

10164.desc: It's battle after battle, but while caught up in them you feel a new,  yet strange power approaching. It feels familiar somehow though...
10164.name: War Ravages Anew

10165.desc: After defeating Shusui anew, you head towards the end of the bridge. However, you feel that demonic presence again. You know which demon awaits now.
10165.name: Truth and Falsehood

10170.desc: The demon Mora suddenly appears before you again. What is a demon's shadow? And just what could be going on in Ishgria?
10170.name: Smiling Trickster

10200.desc: The lava before you makes you falter a little. No matter how many trying places you've visited, you'll need resolve to get out of this one.
10200.name: Blistering March

10201.desc: The air carries the fiery breath of a dragon. There's no doubt that a group of them is nearby. Best move quietly to avoid any confrontations.
10201.name: Fire Dragon's Nest

10202.desc: It's so hot you want to resort to Lugina's rude vocabulary to describe the temperature. Your skin stings too, perhaps because you're a bit burnt?
10202.name: Color of Fire

10203.desc: The sound of the lava flow is unexpectedly pleasant, until you suddenly hear a deafening roar. It might be smart to prepare for battle.
10203.name: Roaring Pyre

10204.desc: This hell-like lava path seems to be almost over. However, menacing presences still lurk about. Could this be the demon's assassins?
10204.name: Lava Pool

10210.desc: Very impactful scenery suddenly comes into view. A deep red sea spreads before your eyes. Its hue makes you realize anew you're in another world.
10210.name: Scarlet Seashore

10211.desc: Though the sea has a red tint to it, its smell is not strange at all. This disparity makes you uncomfortable and highly confuses you.
10211.name: Red Tide

10212.desc: You've seen the sea dyed by the colors of the sunset before, but you're sure this water's hue is something entirely different. You start feeling sick.
10212.name: Rouge Sea

10213.desc: The "Six Armors" that Mora mentioned, which rival demonic powers, start to bug you. You may have to fight them in the future.
10213.name: Struggle to the Death

10214.desc: Are all of Ishgria's oceans red? While thinking that to yourself, a horde of enemies shows up. This is no time to take it easy.
10214.name: Waves of Blood

10220.desc: Seria was right. This place really doesn't resemble a laboratory. However, if you look closely you'll see a lot of strange equipment.
10220.name: Leftover Mark

10221.desc: The ruins turned laboratory are being swallowed by the forest. You can feel great vitality coming from the plants growing along the walls.
10221.name: Eroded by the Forest

10222.desc: Even though the facility has been eroded by the forest, a part of it still seems to be alive. The science behind it was indeed efficient.
10222.name: Foliage Valley

10223.desc: A very misplaced and dense floral aroma drifts in the air. You still don't know much about Ishgria's nature, so you would do well to be cautious.
10223.name: Dangerous Scent

10224.desc: You're almost out of the laboratory, but Lugina and Paris are still nowhere to be seen. Seria's also taken her own path, so just keep moving forward.
10224.name: Shield & Lance

10230.desc: As something fearsome drops from the heavens and comes after you, you realize there is no room to talk. The battle has already started.
10230.name: Dangerous Wind

10231.desc: The strong wind doesn't cease blowing. The wood of the gigantic and heavy windmill towering over you makes a loud creaking noise as it turns.
10231.name: Heavenly Wind

10232.desc: The strong wind may be somewhat depressing, but at least it's neither too hot nor too cold. There's no apparent danger in sight either.
10232.name: Gale Path

10233.desc: A violent squall almost sent you flying. Looks like this is yet another place where you can't let your guard down. Be careful.
10233.name: Alarming Squall

10234.desc: Though the windmill seems pretty old, it is still in very good condition, and even mobile. Could this have been the energy source for the lab?
10234.name: Strong Wind Dynamics

10240.desc: Beiorg shows himself before you again. Would it be wise to fight this enemy with a function that makes him stronger after every defeat?
10240.name: Beiorg Strikes Again

10241.desc: While looking at the landscape you realize that both demons and humans must have lived here long ago. Could humans really have inhabited Ishgria?
10241.name: Temple Ruins

10242.desc: After passing numerous alleys on a hill, you finally find the main road. However, where could the inhabitants of such a great city have gone?
10242.name: Aurora Boulevard

10243.desc: When you turn on a corner of the main road, you see that a group of enemies has been waiting for you. Could these be the protectors of this old city?
10243.name: Star Lane

10244.desc: You have reached the outer wall of the old city. It may be due to the materials it's made of, but it's still somehow untarnished and pearly white.
10244.name: Ivory Castle

10250.desc: If you climb this set of strange-looking stairs, you will reach the old castle. However, climbing all these stairs is slightly depressing.
10250.name: Persistent Attacks

10251.desc: The stairs keep going up, and up. You start to worry about Owen, but according to what Seria and Lugina said, you just have to trust he's fine.
10251.name: Curtain of Night

10252.desc: Even though there seems to be no end to this staircase, the enemies don't find it a problem to attack you. Be careful not to miss your step and fall.
10252.name: Decaying Corpses

10253.desc: Due to the nature of this place, you can't avoid any fights. On top of that, enemies keep attacking you from high places, so you're in a tough spot.
10253.name: Shadow of Coercion

10254.desc: You can see the entrance to the castle. Once you clear the next wave of enemies, you should be able to go inside. That's where the real battle awaits.
10254.name: Awaiting the End

10260.desc: You destroy all the mechanisms you see before you as you move forth. It's possible that Karl is here, but what would he be doing in this place?
10260.name: Mechanized Fortress

10261.desc: As you look at the lights that flash on the floors and walls, you feel as if you had been swallowed by a giant machine. Perhaps that's what happened?
10261.name: Circuit Courtyard

10262.desc: You keep destroying all the equipment you lay your eyes upon, but nothing seems to happen. What is the purpose of all these gadgets anyway?
10262.name: Wired Hall

10263.desc: Beiorg seems to be able to alter his stature and size, but there's no way he'd make the castle a part of his body...is there?
10263.name: Throne of Gears

10264.desc: By the way, where did Beiorg run off to? If this place is as important as Mora claims, then he should be here to protect it, and yet...
10264.name: Gate of Driving Force

10265.desc: As you wander around the silent castle, you hear a strange sound echo through its halls. It seems like Beiorg is on his way to you after all!
10265.name: Indestructible Arms

10270.desc: Behind the castle and down the cliff lies a forest of dry trees. Will another demonic shadow show itself here? No more demons should be around, but...
10270.name: Destroyed God

10300.desc: Owen says one shouldn't have overly positive expectations. Let your guard down for a second, and you will be defeated. Better prepare yourself well.
10300.name: The First Summoner

10301.desc: The city is burning. What could be the fuel of these flames, and when will they stop burning? Ishgria is truly a strange place.
10301.name: A City Ablaze

10302.desc: Speckles of fire keep falling like rain. What could have happened to this place that is now burning? The mystery only deepens.
10302.name: Rain of Fire

10303.desc: The inside of the structure is as hot as a furnace. A minute longer inside, and you'll be cooked alive. Hurry towards the giant flowers.
10303.name: Overwhelming Fire

10304.desc: As you pass the city, the fire is not as intense, but the amount of smoke is overwhelming. Breathing it in could be dangerous, so hurry along.
10304.name: Within the Smoke

10310.desc: You reach a lifeless lake housing water that is clearly not meant for drinking. The miasma that has settled in the place makes your stay unbearable.
10310.name: Stagnant Water

10311.desc: The stench makes you frown as you stumble about. If you spend too long here, your insides may just get poisoned.
10311.name: Poison-Filled Lake

10312.desc: The atmosphere is terrible. It must be hard for the demons to live here, but impossible for humans to do the same. It weakens the spirit.
10312.name: Rising Miasma

10313.desc: A section of the lake seems to be boiling. However, it's not water springing forth, nor is the water really boiling. It's the effect of pollution.
10313.name: Polluted Water

10314.desc: Could this lake and the burning city have been in their current state since the beginning? Or is there a reason behind their extreme conditions?
10314.name: Within the Mud

10320.desc: The giant flowers which gave this region its name finally come into sight. The miasma they release is so strong, it can be seen with the naked eye...
10320.name: Giant Miasma Flowers

10321.desc: Could the flowers' miasma be pollen? The miasma that fills the air is even more hazardous to one's health than the lake's pollution.
10321.name: Sprinkling Miasma

10322.desc: You begin to feel dizzy. The miasma is starting to take its toll. Cover your mouth with some cloth, and try not to breathe it all in.
10322.name: Scattered Pollen

10323.desc: Why would these dangerous plants settle in the city ruins? Do they not affect the demons as well? That seems improbable somehow...
10323.name: Within the Stench

10324.desc: You encounter a revolting creature. If you don't get out of here now, your body will suffer irreparable damage.
10324.name: Rotting Body

10330.desc: Who could that creepy man have been? He looked human enough, but...does he live in Ishgria? He can't be trusted.
10330.name: Gushing Power

10331.desc: Could crossing this long bridge made entirely of metal be really safe? Lightning won't stop flashing, so you can't seem to calm down...
10331.name: Thunder Path

10332.desc: The bridge is very high up, and falling would send you head-first into the red water below. Your chances of surviving such a fall are slim though...
10332.name: Lightning Run

10333.desc: Treading carefully, you cross the bridge with extreme caution. Touching it could lead to an electric shock, so you don't want to fight here, but...
10333.name: Someone Draws Near

10334.desc: You had no idea of what to do when Shusui attacked you on such a narrow bridge, but you somehow survived the encounter. Just a little further now.
10334.name: Within the Electricity

10340.desc: Karl said he still has his doubts, and those words echo in your head. However, the enemy could care less and attacks you.
10340.name: Remaining Light

10341.desc: The fluids of demons lie scattered around everywhere, making you feel sick. Mora claimed it was because of the flowers' miasma, but...
10341.name: Luminous Tower

10342.desc: That demon seems to have been Lucius's old disciple, but you've heard nothing of the sort before. Would Ark know about him?
10342.name: Overflowing Light

10343.desc: What could have happened to Owen and that man? Owen would never fall for the traps lying around these parts, but...
10343.name: Flickering Past

10344.desc: As you go deeper within the lair, you feel a cold chill about you. Could there be something at the bottom? You should go take a look.
10344.name: Within the Flashes

10350.desc: What could have that man meant to say? He said he resents the Summoners of Old...so could he be a Summoner himself?
10350.name: Hole of Darkness

10351.desc: Crystals that sparkle amidst the darkness are beautiful. They are lovely to look at, but could they really be as dangerous as that man claims?
10351.name: Demon Crystal Cave

10352.desc: You've heard many legends that tell of beautiful crystals which can grant demonic powers. Could these be the same crystals of lore?
10352.name: Falling Shadow

10353.desc: The enemies here are stronger than those outside. Could it be the work of the crystals? Be careful not to get possessed by them.
10353.name: Secretive Demon

10354.desc: You know you're almost out of the cave when you feel a draft. The old castle where the demon Melord awaits shouldn't be too far now.
10354.name: Within the Darkness

10360.desc: You don't mind being entrusted with Karl, but you want to discuss what's going on with him. Look for Karl as soon as you finish that demon.
10360.name: Arrogance

10361.desc: The castle is in shambles. The passage of time, the influence of that rotting demon, and Owen's rage must have destroyed it. Time to find that demon.
10361.name: Beacon of Opposition

10362.desc: Grahdens mentioned that someone in Ishgria resents the Summoners of Old. However, the existence of such a creature is surprising in itself.
10362.name: Submissive Power

10363.desc: As you go deeper into the castle, a familiar stench hits your nostrils. Melord seems to be near, so hurry towards him.
10363.name: Scorn & Envy

10364.desc: The slime on the walls is still fresh. You hear something that sounds like Owen on a rampage. You have to keep moving forward.
10364.name: Shining Lamp

10365.desc: Melord, Lucius's former disciple, now lives as a demon corrupted by the miasma and demon crystals. Make sure you're in top shape for this fight.
10365.name: Losing Oneself

10370.desc: You find Melord in a graveyard of rotting ships. Now the disciple of the Sealed God comes after you to do the bidding of his master!
10370.name: Sealed God's Disciple

10400.desc: Lava flows systematically around this place, creating black smoke. According to Mora, this place is based on a factory from another world.
10400.name: Flowing Heat

10401.desc: Owen advances even farther. The cowardly enemies that have avoided his path now come after you in return.
10401.name: Sickening Heat

10402.desc: The heat of the lava intensifies the atmosphere around you. Fighting under these conditions makes it hard to breathe. Careful not to break something.
10402.name: Burning Splash

10403.desc: Apparently, what's flowing around is not lava, but molten metal. Is someone trying to build something with all this material?
10403.name: Within the Melting Point

10404.desc: A wind that could burn your skin comes blasting in. This doesn't seem to be a part of the factory, but of a strong enemy waiting ahead.
10404.name: Endless Fire

10410.desc: Paris was concerned about the large number of liquid-type monsters, but it seems those creatures can adapt to the habitat of any world.
10410.name: Within the Light

10411.desc: Luminous water flows freely around you. Could the speckles of light in it be bugs? Even the flowers growing around the basin seem to glow.
10411.name: Outrageous Torrent

10412.desc: Is this glowing water safe to drink? You spot a Squirty playing in it and can't help but wonder if this is the source of its larger evolutions.
10412.name: Shining Ripples

10413.desc: Though this shiny water is strange, it is beautiful in its own way. If there were no danger lurking about, it would be the perfect place for a stroll.
10413.name: Dancing Lights

10414.desc: The smell of the coast wafts in, though there is no ocean in sight. It's safer to assume that a powerful enemy is behind it instead.
10414.name: Solemn River of Light

10420.desc: Karl's secrecy has you very upset. But it doesn't seem like he has changed at the core, so that relieves you somewhat.
10420.name: Growing Power

10421.desc: Seemingly a clump of plants from afar, from up close one can see that a lot of care was put into planting these trees. This garden was man-made.
10421.name: Circle of Life

10422.desc: The glass ceiling lets a strange light shine in. This light and the temperature are both regulated, making the perfect environment for these plants.
10422.name: Jumping Plants

10423.desc: Taking a closer look, you notice there are also plants from Elgaia in this garden. Scientists could potentially make great discoveries in this place.
10423.name: Fragrance of Nature

10424.desc: You're taken aback by the great tree in the middle of the garden. Could it be the great and otherworldly Alpha Tree?
10424.name: Artificial Nature

10430.desc: Mirfah challenges you to a duel to learn your true intentions. You cannot just ignore him, so prepare yourself and do the best you can.
10430.name: Accumulating Wreckage

10431.desc: Independence from the gods. This is a story you have heard a few times before. However, you must press forward for Tilith's sake.
10431.name: Rumbling Earthquake

10432.desc: There are pieces of machinery scattered all over the place. They are piled up so high that you fear they make come crashing down.
10432.name: Broken Order

10433.desc: Could these metal scraps have been part of a failed experiment to revive otherworldly techniques? In that case, this place could be a treasure trove.
10433.name: Scattered Past

10434.desc: A thunderous roar makes the metal scraps come crashing down. This beast's underground cry resonates in the air. A powerful enemy must await ahead.
10434.name: Ruins Full of Power

10440.desc: A bright light shines over the great metropolis. Its size and structure rival those of Randall. However, oddly enough, no one seems to live here.
10440.name: Brilliant Megalopolis

10441.desc: Could developed metropolises such as this one exist in other worlds? Perhaps Randall will come to resemble it someday .
10441.name: Ten Thousand Lights

10442.desc: Could the demon ruling this land be an entirely different being? So far it doesn't seem interested in a fight.
10442.name: Nightless Castle

10443.desc: Though you're wondering why the demon of this land has not sought you out, don't forget that a certain persistent demon may come seeking a fight.
10443.name: Dashing Ray of Light

10444.desc: There is a great disc shining from above. It looks like it's at the top of a tower. However, there's something odd about it...
10444.name: Towards the Light

10450.desc: You descend into a gloomy underground road completely different from the world above. The walls and floor are dirty, and even the air feels polluted.
10450.name: The World Below

10451.desc: The world above was magnificent, but the world below leaves much to be desired. Why would demons come all the way down here looking for shelter?
10451.name: Suppressive Corruption

10452.desc: You can't help but wonder how people would be able to live underground in this place if it were truly a possibility.
10452.name: Secret in the Dark

10453.desc: Underneath the city of light there is a place the light cannot touch. Even if technology fixed this in the future, society wouldn't probably allow it.
10453.name: Treacherous Heart

10454.desc: There seems to be an even deeper darkness lurking ahead. Walking this underground city makes you feel like you've fallen into the underworld.
10454.name: City of Shadows

10460.desc: It turns out Mordlim was just like the demons before it--an enemy of humanity. What Mora said still has you worried, but you must defeat this demon.
10460.name: Clear Skies

10461.desc: Not only can this device control the weather, but it can also cause disasters automatically. Such dangerous technology must be used with caution.
10461.name: Pouring Rain

10462.desc: Perhaps if Elgaia had the power this tower possesses, there wouldn't be a need for humanity to fight the demons.
10462.name: Enshrouding Clouds

10463.desc: The more you think about it, the more Mordlim's plans sound terrifying. How would've things played out if you hadn't done anything about it?
10463.name: Blowing Wind

10464.desc: You can feel that the demon has a powerful foes awaiting you. A great foe climbs its way to the top, while another descends from above. This is it.
10464.name: Freedom

10465.desc: Unbeknownst to anyone, Mordlim had continued with her sinister plans. If you don't stop her now, the future of humankind could be lost forever!
10465.name: Master of Creation

10470.desc: There is a secret sky garden behind the botanical garden. You're pretty sure you will encounter the demon Mordlim there, though she's been defeated.
10470.name: Curious Lesser Gods

10500.desc: Having passed through lava belts all across the land, you should be used to places like this. Avoid taking risks, and watch your step.
10500.name: Defiant Flames

10501.desc: It seems the demon that rules this land has hair a color unlike any you have seen thus far. You could say it's very demonic, or not demonic at all.
10501.name: Commander of Flames

10502.desc: The air here pulses with the heat. It is so intense that your sweat evaporates in an instant. Stay hydrated, and always be prepared for combat.
10502.name: Magician's Blaze

10503.desc: The enemies you face at every turn here are quite strong. However, you have built up ample power to defeat them. Move ahead boldly!
10503.name: Chaotic Fires

10504.desc: An incandescent wind blows by. The lava road seems to have an exit ahead, where the heat is most intense. A formidable foe most likely awaits you.
10504.name: Breaching Black Fires

10510.desc: Mora continues to use you. It might be time to start thinking about what she aims to achieve with all her plotting.
10510.name: An Icy Gaze

10511.desc: A metallic scent unlike the rusted iron smell of the red sea tickles your nose. It seems that Elgaian common sense doesn't apply to Ishgria.
10511.name: Trio of Brilliant Ice

10512.desc: Mora said that it was impossible to comprehend Amu Yunos's thinking, but you have a feeling that the same is true of her and Shusui.
10512.name: Blue Tower of Ice

10513.desc: Suddenly, you can smell the salty breeze from a familiar sea. You should assume that this kind of change indicates a strong enemy is on its way.
10513.name: Howl of the Icy Sea

10514.desc: You can see a dense forest ahead of you. It seems you will need to pass through it to reach the tower. Proceed down this beach just a little further.
10514.name: Ice Battle Dance

10520.desc: It's good you were able to ask Karl's opinion. Even if your objectives are different, Karl wants to help Tilith just as much as you do.
10520.name: Insatiable Forest

10521.desc: As you head to the ruins that the forest has enveloped, you catch unsettling glimpses of what seems to be a giant through the trees.
10521.name: Dancing Greenery

10522.desc: The ancient cobblestones are so overgrown with moss that they are hardly recognizable. This seems like a nice place for a walk, a rarity in Ishgria.
10522.name: Trembling Forest

10523.desc: The trees around you began to rustle. A wind is blowing past, deeper into the forest. It seems someone is inviting you in. Be prepared for battle.
10523.name: Forest Boundaries

10524.desc: When you think about it, you haven't seen Shusui for a while. Could he have given up? If so, you shouldn't need to worry about him, but...
10524.name: Forested Battle Lines

10530.desc: The sky is filled with black clouds that flash with never-ending lightning. All there is to see around you is an expanse of barren earth.
10530.name: Guiding Thunder

10531.desc: Since you have a good view and allies with you, you can focus on enemies approaching from ahead. But watch your back just in case.
10531.name: Thunderous Sky

10532.desc: Lightning flashes, illuminating the sky. You hear an earsplitting roar and a suspicious shadow passes high above. It seems you have airborne enemies.
10532.name: Defiant Thunder

10533.desc: You heard a cliff collapsing over the thunder. Something large is approaching, shaking the earth as it does. You won't get away without fighting.
10533.name: Wild Thunder Valley

10534.desc: You made your way close to the castle. Now you need to climb a trail up the cliffs, but you'll have to fight difficult foes here as well.
10534.name: Splendid Thunderclaps

10540.desc: You have learned what the Akras Summoners' Hall was truly after. And you think it might tie into saving Tilith. There's no room for hesitation now.
10540.name: Light of Annihilation

10541.desc: This castle seems to be quite old, but it doesn't look weathered at all. Actually, it seems in excellent condition. Is someone maintaining it?
10541.name: Judgment of the Light

10542.desc: Despite its formidable exterior, inside the castle is refined and sophisticated. It's said that Amu Yunos has always ruled this land, but...
10542.name: Shining White Light

10543.desc: From this high up in the castle, you are able to see the giant's face directly. Once again, you are amazed at its unimaginable size.
10543.name: Praying to the Light

10544.desc: It seems there's a passage that extends from the castle to the neighboring mountains, offering an exit. But it also appears to lead toward the giant.
10544.name: Advent of Holy Light

10550.desc: You sensed something from Mora that wasn't there before; something like confusion. You feel like you understand Seria's concern a little better.
10550.name: Evil in the Darkness

10551.desc: You sense an almost-familiar presence. It could be that Shusui has caught up with you. Time to hurry.
10551.name: Dark Necromancy

10552.desc: The great giant's remains seem to be holding their form without decaying or breaking down. Is this the power of Amu Yunos at work?
10552.name: Through the Darkness

10553.desc: Even while untouched by decay, the giant's corpse somehow makes you starkly aware of death. Are you over-thinking things?
10553.name: Realm of Darkness

10554.desc: You have reached the giant's feet. You should be able to walk to Amu Yunos's tower from here. You must be prepared for anything.
10554.name: Dark Phantom Aura

10560.desc: You never dreamed that a demon would call you chaotic. Maybe you should be more aware of the things you've done so far.
10560.name: Quiet Skies

10561.desc: You defeated the Four Fallen Gods and Lucius, and now demons fall before you wherever you go. Will you also take out Karna Masta in the future?
10561.name: Uncertain Moon

10562.desc: Mora said that eight of them sealed Karna Masta, which means there are two other demons besides Amu Yunos.
10562.name: Viewing the Galaxy

10563.desc: You need to defeat the demons to save Tilith. But if you do that, the seal on Karna Masta will break...
10563.name: Intoxicating Stars

10564.desc: Before you knew it, the top floor was but a few steps away. It's dangerous to fight while distracted. Make sure to keep yourself together.
10564.name: Ends Yet Unseen

10565.desc: Amu Yunos is a demon you must face to save Tilith. That's all the reason you need to fight. Prepare for battle.
10565.name: Hour of Disaster

10566.desc: For some reason, you have to face Owen now. If you refuse, Owen will probably flatten you anyway. So your only choice is to take him head on!
10566.name: Time to Move

10570.desc: When you step into the glistening crystal cave, it seems there is a demon deep within. Amu Yunos's Shadow likely awaits you.
10570.name: Hour of Agreement

10571.desc: You sense serenity in Mirfah's expression, unlike before. Sometimes, fighting just to see who's strongest feels good.
10571.name: Retribution Demon

10600.desc: An individual with the head of a dragon suddenly attacks. He identifies himself as a follower of the land's demon ruler, and you must fight back.
10600.name: Dragon Disciple Raid

10601.desc: Disciple Liomerg addressed Karl respectfully. It seems that the demon in Karl's bloodline is the ruler of this land.
10601.name: Calamity's Howling

10602.desc: The flames form first a firestorm, then spin into towering fire whirls. Who knows what happens if you get close to them. Be careful as you advance!
10602.name: Uphill Invasion

10603.desc: It might be your imagination, but it seems like the enemies here are much more self-aware than any before, and that their attacks are more strategic.
10603.name: Defense and Counters

10604.desc: You're almost clear of the land of burning winds. Your clothes smell a bit charred. You've got to hurry ahead before they catch fire.
10604.name: Battle Tendency

10610.desc: Karl seems dead set on fighting no matter what. You're not done trying to talk him down yet, but you may need to face him in combat.
10610.name: Sunken City

10611.desc: You feel you need to defeat Karna Masta. If you don't, humanity will forever live in fear of the god's resurrection.
10611.name: Towering Shadows

10612.desc: You really want to believe in Karl. Despite this, you don't think the demon menace will go away even if Ishgria is unified.
10612.name: Tragic Destiny

10613.desc: Even if Karna Masta weren't a threat, you would need to eliminate the demon threat in order to free Tilith.
10613.name: Origin of Resistance

10614.desc: Regardless of whatever the demon Barion thought, you can't be sure without actually meeting it. Time to get moving.
10614.name: The Guide of Eras

10620.desc: A beautiful view of the continent extends before you. Compared to some other places, it's actually quite scenic.
10620.name: Clash of Powers

10621.desc: Circle around a cliff, climb a slope, look for a path, and climb back down, again and again. But you caught sight of something like a waterfall ahead.
10621.name: Dividing Walls

10622.desc: On cresting a particularly high hill, you realized that the waterfall was actually a structure damming the river. You will need to get through it.
10622.name: Insurmountable Rise

10623.desc: Suddenly, you remember Mora's words. You can't imagine her becoming an ally, but if possible, you'd rather not have her as an enemy.
10623.name: Sheltered Crossroads

10624.desc: You can faintly hear what seems to be rushing water. That dam-like structure must be close. The enemies are fighting harder, as well.
10624.name: Do-or-Die Resolve

10630.desc: There's nothing you can say to Paris in her distress. You just have to believe she'll find an answer for herself.
10630.name: Deadly Gatekeeper

10631.desc: Apparently, this massive dam also functions as a fortress. The interior is maze-like, and it won't be easy to get through.
10631.name: Open Road Ahead

10632.desc: Formidable foes lie in wait at key points. As you fight an unpleasant thought crosses your mind, and you wonder if Karl sent them there.
10632.name: Obstructing the Path

10633.desc: You have gotten lost in the fortress. You need to focus on moving ahead after all, without getting distracted by pointless questions.
10633.name: A Tricky Bottleneck

10634.desc: You arrived at the fortress's dam control room. According to the map found in the room, you should be able to get out from here.
10634.name: Heart of The Citadel

10640.desc: It seems that Karl wasn't able to fully awaken the demonic power within himself. Perhaps he still has some doubts...
10640.name: Welcoming Gate

10641.desc: If Karl is still uncertain, you know what you need to do. Eliminate the threats of the demons and Karna Masta, and save Tilith.
10641.name: Plaza of Worship

10642.desc: You leave the plaza and find yourself on the main street. Across the bridge ahead is the gate to the outskirts of town. Liomerg is probably there.
10642.name: Noble City

10643.desc: Apparently, formidable foes await you on the bridge. You want to conserve your strength before fighting Liomerg, but that may be impossible.
10643.name: Bridge of Purity

10644.desc: Liomerg stands before the gate. You don't see Karl, but he's probably watching. You can't embarrass yourself now.
10644.name: Past Death's Door

10650.desc: This isn't your first fight with Lugina. But he says he'll show you a new power he had kept hidden, so this won't go like the last time.
10650.name: Spider's Web

10651.desc: You're advancing across a gigantic spider's web. The thick threads are stable, but watch your step. Especially since you're up against Lugina.
10651.name: Frayed Threads

10652.desc: Lose your footing and you'll fall into the depths. It seems like there's water down there, but this is Ishgria. You won't come out unscathed.
10652.name: Between the Threads

10653.desc: Lugina's fighting spirit... That feeling you get when you face a formidable foe... You need to get serious, before Lugina summons his true strength.
10653.name: Woven Power

10654.desc: You see Lugina laughing as though he's invincible. He has the advantage no matter where you approach from. Be careful, and give it your all!
10654.name: Knife-Edged Battle

10660.desc: As expected, it's difficult to talk with demons. But they might be more cooperative if you demonstrate your power?
10660.name: Dragon Talon Breaker

10661.desc: You head for the summit, defeating one enemy after another. You start to wonder if demons are only capable of understanding others through combat.
10661.name: Piercing Dragon Horn

10662.desc: You approach the midpoint of the mountain trail. Ahead, at the peak, you can sense a presence so powerful it stifles your spirit. Is it a dragon?
10662.name: Dragon Scale Defense

10663.desc: A gate capable of moving Karna Masta, seal and all... But you're worried that a power on that level just might break the seal.
10663.name: Flying Dragon Dance

10664.desc: You see Liomerg on the final incline before the peak. This is probably the end of the line. Get ready for a decisive battle!
10664.name: Blinding Dragon Speed

10665.desc: Only the demon Barion remains. If you can't win here, it would be foolish to face Karna Masta. It's time to show your power!
10665.name: Ascended Dragon's Eye

10670.desc: You have to face the demon Kalon's Shadow alongside Lugina. The true seal on Karna Masta should break soon as well. The time to fight draws near.
10670.name: Watchful Guide

10671.desc: It's been a long time since you fought with Paris. She wants to fight to overcome her doubts. With that in mind, you want to give your all.
10671.name: Thunderbird Awakens

10700.desc: Mora states her goal is to unify the world and end all conflict. But she is a demon, too. For that reason alone she won't avoid friction.
10700.name: Persistent Flame

10701.desc: Mora didn't come out and say it, but she wants help. Even so, everyone is resolved. They can't accede to her ambitions.
10701.name: Yesterday's Glory

10702.desc: It seems this facility pumps up oil from beneath the sea floor. A lot of devices made with otherworldly technologies use this oil.
10702.name: Unfailing Light

10703.desc: Some of the oil that is pumped up is burned to remove impurities. That is why this facility belches forth flames endlessly.
10703.name: Surging Vigor

10704.desc: Clouds of black, poisonous smoke stand in your way. You want to hurry ahead to the snowy plains after Mora, but the enemies in your way come first.
10704.name: Smokey Battle

10710.desc: Your allies seem alright. Rescue can wait; focus on fighting Mora. Your fate was to face her. Hopefully this will be the last time for it, though.
10710.name: Ice Fissures

10711.desc: You must assemble demonic powers to face Karna Masta. That means that if Mora wasn't lying, you'll need her help.
10711.name: Endless White

10712.desc: A raging wind chills you to the bone, and drowns out the sound of your footsteps. All you can see is white, and you still have a long way to go.
10712.name: Freezing Wrath

10713.desc: You can barely keep to the path due to the blizzard. But you won't lose sight of your goal. Advance without wavering, so you can rescue Tilith.
10713.name: Unwavering

10714.desc: All you can do is focus on advancing as you push through deep snowdrifts. Suddenly a fierce wind springs up, and the blizzard intensifies.
10714.name: Snowy Welcome

10720.desc: You were finally released from the blizzard's abuse thanks to your arrival in the frozen woods. But the cold is unchanged, and your hands are numb.
10720.name: Frozen Pines

10721.desc: It feels as though time itself has frozen in the silence of these woods. You let out a deep sigh, and continue to advance steadily.
10721.name: Transparent Heart

10722.desc: Snow falls through the gaps between trees. Sometimes, a clump falls from the branches noisily, startling you by sounding like an enemy's approach.
10722.name: Grove of Flurries

10723.desc: The white snow and dark trees deceive your eyes. Deep snowdrifts entangle your legs. Protracted fighting here is harder than you imagined.
10723.name: Silent White Woods

10724.desc: The trees have thinned out. You are almost out of the woods, and you miss warmer lands. Hopefully somewhere more sheltered is coming up next.
10724.name: White Continent

10730.desc: There is a gate of appropriate size for the immense valley it blocks off built across the precipice. It seems to be mechanical.
10730.name: Electrified Gates

10731.desc: A single path extends toward the mechanical gate. It seems you will have to fight Shusui here after all. Prepare yourself.
10731.name: Moment of Insight

10732.desc: There's something weird and mechanical on the path. Could it be a device for transferring power generated at the oil well?
10732.name: Lightning Speed

10733.desc: While it's better than the plains or the woods, it's still cold here. It's so cold that you're almost eager to fight with Shusui already.
10733.name: Crossing Currents

10734.desc: Is Shusui covered in wounds from his battle with Owen? Or was it one of Mora's traps? Either way, you can't hold back against him.
10734.name: The Name Shusui

10740.desc: You are finally free of the cold. Truthfully, it's cold here too, but still so much warmer than you have been for a while. You feel alive again.
10740.name: Scattering Light

10741.desc: You're inside a cave, but its walls of transparent ice let the outside light shine in. It reflects off every surface, eliminating all shadows.
10741.name: Illuminated Path

10742.desc: Sound reverberates in the cave just as light reflects. Your footsteps echo many times over, and it sounds almost like you're leading a small army.
10742.name: A Bright Future

10743.desc: You emerged into a spacious cavern. The refracted light is concentrated here, and some of the ice is melted. It's also a bit warm, thankfully.
10743.name: Reflected Light

10744.desc: Your eyes are growing tired, possibly because of the shining cave. They're also dry, and your vision is blurry. Getting attacked now would be risky.
10744.name: Captivating Lands

10750.desc: Lugina said Karl's kindness was weakness. So what is strength? In all its grandeur, nature gives no answer.
10750.name: Cold, Dark Places

10751.desc: A vicious, howling wind rolls over the side of the cliffs. Your body is stripped of all the warmth it accumulated within the cave in an instant.
10751.name: Closed Paths

10752.desc: You climb the path that juts out from the ice wall. At each crossroads you come across you must choose the safest-looking one from many options.
10752.name: Wall of Darkness

10753.desc: You should arrive at the castle where Mora awaits once you make it up this cliff. Looking up or down is terrifying, but you just have to keep going.
10753.name: Impartial Clarity

10754.desc: You've gotten close to the top. If you lose your footing here you're finished, yet your enemies fight without concern for the location. Be careful.
10754.name: Sub-zero Cliffs

10760.desc: You proceed down the path that Lugina and Seria cleared as they went ahead. But then enemies appeared, as though they were waiting. It's an ambush.
10760.name: Blockaded Gate

10761.desc: This former stronghold of a demon leader is as elegant and impressive as you would expect. Even long years later, that hasn't changed.
10761.name: Frozen Past

10762.desc: It's said that the demons fell into an era of chaotic war after their leader left. It would appear this castle's purpose was lost afterwards, as well.
10762.name: Closed Doors

10763.desc: The two Summoners of Old are here, as are Bertz and Liomerg. The key will probably be whoever finds Mora first.
10763.name: Bound Memories

10764.desc: Apparently, this castle's original master had un-demonly dreams of eliminating conflict. Mora said she was taking up that quest, but...
10764.name: Forbidden Hopes

10765.desc: Alongside Seria, you challenge Mora. Having absorbed the other demons, Mora is much stronger than ever before. Don't hold back!
10765.name: Gathering Powers

10766.desc: Postpone your happiness for reuniting with Tilith and defeat Mora! Now is your chance, while her power is out of control!
10766.name: Spiritual Heir

10770.desc: Face Seria's feelings, and give this battle your all. It will help your friend find her own path.
10770.name: Desire to be the Best

10771.desc: Barion shows his true power and form. Face him alongside Karl, whose demonic powers have awakened! The answer Karl seeks must lie ahead.
10771.name: True Dragon's Power
